events.title: Florida becomes the 27th U.S. State
events.description: Florida was admitted to the United States as the 27th state, expanding the country and impacting the balance between free and slave states.
events.significance: This statehood impacted U.S. politics and sectional tensions leading up to the Civil War.

events.title: The First Volume of the 'Je Sais Tout' Magazine Published
events.description: The French popular science magazine 'Je Sais Tout' was first published, contributing to the spread of scientific knowledge among the general public.
events.significance: Helped popularize science and knowledge in France during the 19th century.

events.title: The Star-Spangled Banner Officially Becomes U.S. National Anthem
events.description: The United States Congress passed a law that made 'The Star-Spangled Banner' the official national anthem of the United States.
events.significance: Established a key national symbol and patriotic song for the United States.

events.title: Boris Yeltsin Becomes President of Russia
events.description: Boris Yeltsin was sworn in as the first elected President of the Russian Federation, marking the start of a new era in post-Soviet Russia.
events.significance: Signaled a shift from Soviet communism to a new political and economic system in Russia.

events.title: Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia, and Slovenia join NATO
events.description: These countries signed accession protocols to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), expanding the alliance eastward.
events.significance: Strengthened NATOâ€™s presence in Eastern Europe and reshaped European security dynamics.
